headline: GM, Other US Automakers Face Sharp Profit Squeeze From Trump Tariffs, Analysts Warn
summary: The U.S. auto industry may be staring down a massive profitability crunch as President-elect Donald Trump's proposed 25% tariffs on vehicle imports from Mexico and Canada threaten to squeeze margins by nearly one-fifth, according to S&P Global Ratings. Michigan-based automakers like General Motors Company (NYSE:GM), Stellantis N.V. (NYSE:STLA), and Ford Motor Co. (NYSE:F) could lose up to 17% of their combined annual EBITDA – a financial acronym that stands for earnings before interest, taxes, d

headline: Volkswagen Workers to Begin Striking Monday, Union Says
summary: IG Metall said its members would down tools for a few hours a day after the auto giant and union leaders failed to agree on how to cut costs.

raw.headline: Volkswagen Workers to Begin Striking Monday, Union Says
raw.summary: IG Metall said its members would down tools for a few hours a day after the auto giant and union leaders failed to agree on how to cut costs.

headline: Ford: EVs Remain The Path To Despair
summary: Ford's EV business is a significant loss-maker, dragging down overall margins and earnings, with no improvement in sight. See what makes F a sell-rated stock.

raw.headline: Ford: EVs Remain The Path To Despair

headline: For EV Startups, Things Are Going From Bad to Worse
summary: Makers and suppliers of electric cars are dealing with diminishing cash, uneven sales and the prospects of an unfriendly Trump administration.

headline: Rivian: EV Subsidies Are Ending (Rating Downgrade)
summary: Rivian faces significant challenges as EV subsidies end, making it difficult to compete with Tesla and Ford. Find out why I believe RIVN shares are a sell.
